title: Spinning a Wheel for a Discount: Determining Shape
question_text: A car dealership is having a big promotion where customers who purchase a car can spin a spinner to determine how much of a discount they will get off the purchase price.  Discounts range from $\$500$ to $\$2500$ . The spinner is shown below and all wedges on the spinner are equal in area. Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2016. All rights reserved. If a boxplot was created to display the distribution of discount amounts, what would the boxplot reveal about the shape of the distribution?

choices.text: The distribution would be approximately normal.
The distribution would be skewed left.
The distribution would be skewed right.
Since the spinner is really just a pie chart in disguise, the variable of interest is categorical.  Therefore, a boxplot cannot be used to display the distribution of discounts.
